titles.title: Jihad Prevention Act
Jihad Prevention Act
To require aliens to attest that they will not advocate installing a Sharia law system in the United States as a condition for admission, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: Jihad Prevention Act - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to: (1) make an alien who fails to attest that he or she will not advocate installing a Sharia law system in the United States inadmissible for U.S. entry; (2) require the visa revocation of an alien advocating the installation of a Sharia law system in the United States; and (3) make advocating the installation of a Sharia law system in the United States a ground for revocation of naturalization.
